alert.note: Alert for Des Moines (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 9:17PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington affecting all of the counties bordering the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Lock and Dam 18 is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 14.8 feet Saturday April 29th. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.
